kind.description: A lensed arc or lensed extended images in massive cluster
A background quasar lensed by a galaxy cluster showing large image separations (typically, around 20" or higher)
A strong lensing geometry with a plausibly isolated massive galaxy (early or late type) lensing a background galaxy into two (or more) distinct arcs, or a full Einstein Ring.

A strong lensing geometry with a concentrated or isolated galaxy, of any type (early or late), lensing an distant active galactic nucleus (AGN) or quasi stellar object (QSO) into two or more distinct images. The galaxy hosting the AGN/QSO may also be lensed into two or more arcs, or into a full Einstein Ring.

A strong lensing geometry with a group of galaxies (usually but not always dominated by a central massive galaxy), lensing a background galaxy into two (or more) distinct arcs, or a full Einstein Ring.

A strong lensing geometry with a group of galaxies (usually but not always dominated by a central massive galaxy), lensing a background active galactic nucleus (AGN) or quasi stellar object (QSO) into two or more images. The galaxy hosting the AGN/QSO may also be lensed into multiple arcs or an Einstein Ring.
Galaxies lensed by a QSO-dominated lensing galaxy.
A foreground galaxy cluster(s) found in the X-ray. It may have galaxies and/or quasars as the lensed background sources
